title: Public transport for the Harry Styles Concert: Friday 24 February and Saturday 25 February 2023
articleContent:
Public transport for the Harry Styles Concert: Friday 24 February and Saturday 25 February 2023

Grammy Award®-winning, global superstar Harry Styles is bringing his LOVE ON TOUR 2023 world tour to Marvel Stadium. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it. Extra services will help you get home from Marvel Stadium on Friday 24 February & Saturday 25 February 2023.

The gates open at 5:30pm on both nights.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

  • Go to Friday 24 February services
  • Go to Saturday 25 February services
  • View additional information

Friday 24 February 2023

 Metropolitan train

Arriving at Southern Cross before the concert, as follows:

  • Craigieburn departing at 5:51pm, arriving on Platform 11 at 6:29pm

Trains depart Southern Cross after the concert ends, as follows:

  • Camberwell departing at 11:28pm and 11:38pm, Platform 10
  • Glen Waverley departing at 11:13pm and 11:23pm, Platform 10
  • Werribee departing at 11:02pm and 11:21pm, Platform 14
  • Sunbury departing at 11:26pm, Platform 14
  • Craigieburn departing at 11:08pm, Platform 14
  • Southern Cross to Flinders Street departing at 10:56pm and 11:17pm, Platform 13
  • Frankston departing at 11:03pm, Platform 12

Trains depart Flinders Street after the concert ends, as follows:

  • Mernda departing at 11:24pm, Platform 1
  • Greensborough departing at 11:28pm, Platform 1
  • Pakenham departing at 11:20pm, Platform 7
  • Dandenong departing at 11:35pm, Platform 7
  • Sandringham departing at 11:10pm, Platform 13

Passengers travelling on the Mernda, Greensborough, Pakenham, Frankston and Sandringham lines are advised to catch the first available train on Platform 11 or 13 to connect with their services at Flinders Street.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a between East Melbourne and Stop D1 Etihad Stadium via La Trobe Street.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station.

Services depart Southern Cross after the concert ends, as follows:

Additional Coaches:

  • Leaving Coach terminal for Bendigo
  • Leaving Coach terminal for Waurn Ponds (Geelong)
  • Leaving Coach terminal for Wendouree (Ballarat)

All replacement coaches will be leaving from Southern Cross Bus terminal. Passengers are advised to expect queues and delay when returning to this terminal. Please listen to announcements for the designated coach bays for departure.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Saturday 25 February 2023

 Metropolitan train

Arriving at Southern Cross before the concert, as follows:

  • Craigieburn departing at 5:20pm, arriving on Platform 10 at 6:12pm
  • Syndal departing at 5:40pm, arriving on Platform 10 at 6:18pm

Trains depart Southern Cross after the concert ends, as follows:

  • Glen Waverley departing at 11:14pm, 11:24pm and 11:44pm, Platform 10
  • Camberwell departing at 11:19pm, 11:29pm and 11:48, Platform 10
  • Craigieburn departing at 11:02pm, 11:30pm and 11:38pm, Platform 11
  • Broadmeadows departing at 11:12pm, Platform 11

Trains depart Flinders Street after the concert ends, as follows:

  • Mernda departing at 11:47pm, Platform 2
  • Eltham departing at 11:41pm, Platform 2
  • Sandringham departing at 11:30pm, Platform 10
  • Pakenham departing at 11:30pm and 11:50pm, Platform 7
  • Frankston departing at 11:29pm and 11:49pm, Platform 8

Passengers travelling on the Mernda, Greensborough, Pakenham, Frankston and Sandringham lines are advised to catch the first available train on Platform 11 or 13 to connect with their services at Flinders Street.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a between East Melbourne and Stop D1 Etihad Stadium via La Trobe Street.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station.

Services depart Southern Cross after the concert ends, as follows:

Additional Coaches:

  • Leaving Coach terminal for Bendigo
  • Leaving Coach terminal for Waurn Ponds (Geelong)
  • Leaving Coach terminal for Wendouree (Ballarat)
  • Leaving Coach terminal for Traralgon

All replacement coaches will be leaving from Southern Cross Bus terminal. Passengers are advised to expect queues and delay when returning to this terminal. Please listen to announcements for the designated coach bays for departure.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the Harry Styles Concert: Friday 24 February and Saturday 25 February 2023
